location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: Manuscript; crayon and pencil on paperDimensions: 330 x 250mm

mods.abstract: The sketch represents the mouth of the river Nuriab, the Vice-Consulate at Zabul and the surrounding area, after the flood of the river. The sketch, in pencil and red and blue crayon, also provides some indication of relief. The map is dated and signed by Maurice Patrick O'Connor Tandy, Vice-Consul at Zabul.
